original_title: Richmond: Todt Hill Road - Verona Avenue
text:
(1)
Toot Hill Road, east side, between Verona Avenue and Schmidt Lane, showing the old Houseman farmhouse and farm, viewed in a northerly direction. On James Butler's 1853 map of Staten Island it appears as the A. Houseman farm; on Beers's 1874 map as the J. Burgher farm; and on the Robinson maps of 1898 and 1967 and Brownley's map of 1917 as the George J. Greenfield farm. At this date (1939) the exact location of the house would be the north side of Staten Island Boulevard, 100 yards east of Toot Hill Road.
March, 1924

P. L. Sperr

(2)
The rear of the farmhouse and barns, looking northwestward.
August 18, 1926

P. L. Sperr

(3)
A front view of the house, looking southeastward.
August 18, 1926

P. L. Sperr

original_title: Richmond: Todt Hill Road - New York Avenue
text:
(1) Todt Hill Road, east side, between New York Avenue and Merrick Avenue, showing the J. Hankey house. The real estate atlases from 1874 to 1907 show it to have belonged to the above family. It was on the property of Edward W. Brown, in 1917. This is the south side of the house.

November 18, 1910

By Wm. T. Davis through P. L. Sperr

(2) The J. Hankey House, twenty-two years later, when the property was taken over by The Country Day School of the Staten Island Academy.

August 4, 1932

P.L. Sperr

original_title: Richmond: Todt Hill Road - New York Avenue
text:
Todt Hill Road, east side, between Merrick and New York Avenues, looking south and showing the estate which is to be the site of the Country Day School of the Staten Island Academy.

July 19, 1932

P. L. Sperr

(2)

Another view of the estate, viewing from about New York Avenue, in a northerly direction.

August 4, 1932

P. L. Sperr
